data.title: Bill W.M. Ransom
data.meta_description: BA University of Washington, Sociology and English Education; MA Utah State University, Theory and Practice of Writing and Folklore. Seven novels, three co-authored with
data.text:
Poet, Fiction Writer

Author's Bio

BA University of Washington, Sociology and English Education; MA Utah State University, Theory and Practice of Writing and Folklore. Seven novels, three co-authored with Frank Herbert, all available in all formats from WordFire Press; four poetry collections, two hybrid collections--Learning the Ropes and The Woman and the War Baby--linked poetry, fiction, nonfiction. Pioneered Poets in the Schools in WA, ID, UT, WY, NV. Co-founded Centrum, an arts foundation in Washington State; invented and directed the popular Port Townsend Writer's Conference and Centrum's interdisciplinary youth programs. Recently retired as Dean of Curriculum at The Evergreen State College, Olympia WA.

Personal Favorites

Favorite authors:

Raymond Carver, Keith Abbott, Michael O'Connor, Margaret Atwood, Ursula LeGuin, Joy Harjo

What I'm reading now:

The Only Time We Have by Samuel Green, The Violent Foam by Daisy Zamora, The First Thing Coming by Keith Abbott, W. S. Merwin by (Asian Figures), Other Heartbreaks by Patricia Henley
